Knowing the end state \\( z(T) \\), can we unequivocally infer the interventions used (whether the transformations \\( f(z) \\), \\( g(z) \\), or neither) based solely on the value of \\( z(T) \\)?
Explanation: Given the same end state \\( z(T) \\), different combinations of \\( \\alpha \\) and \\( \\beta \\), and their timings, can lead to identical outcomes because the effects on amplitude and phase can mask each other. This makes it impossible to definitively determine which transformations were applied.
